sentences.en: An exercise book containing models of penmanship, used in teaching handwriting.
sentences.cn: 有书法样例的书;在教书法的过程中使用.

sentences.en: Handwriting or penmanship, esp. elegant or " beautiful " writing as a decorative art.
sentences.cn: 书写的艺术, 特别是优雅漂亮可作装饰的 笔迹 .

sentences.en: Handwrititing or penmanship, esp. elegant or beautiful writingasa decorative art.
sentences.cn: 书写的艺术, 特别是优雅漂亮可做装饰的笔迹.

sentences.en: I began to get sloppy in my spelling and grammar and my penmanship deteriorated.
sentences.cn: 我开始忽略了拼写和语法的正确性,我的字也很潦草.

sentences.en: It is a headache to decipher his penmanship.
sentences.cn: 辨认他的潦草的字迹叫人“头痛”.

sentences.en: It is a headache to decipher his sloppy penmanship.
sentences.cn: 辨认他的潦草的字迹叫人头痛.

sentences.en: K . This was probably just poor penmanship on the part of a court clerk, however.
sentences.cn: 然而, 这也可能是因为法院职员糟糕的书法所致.

sentences.en: My sister - in - law knew a master of penmanship whose work is expensive.
sentences.cn: 我 嫂子 认识一位书法大师,他的作品很值钱呢.

sentences.en: Some of his classmates soon shot ahead of him in penmanship.
sentences.cn: 他的一些同学很快在书法方面超过了他.

sentences.en: There are four kinds of means about penmanship and painting art's aesthetic consideration of nature.
sentences.cn: 书法艺术和绘画艺术对大自然的审美观照方法一般有四种:一是对审美客体外观的审美追求.

sentences.en: You must write a copy every morning to improve your penmanship.
sentences.cn: 你必须每天早上临一张帖,以改进你的书法.

words.tran_cn: 笔者；书法家；画家；抄录员

trans.tran_cn: <正>书写艺术，书法，书写技巧，写作
trans.tran_en: the art of writing by hand, or skill in this art
